title: Block Programming with AI
description: Late Elementary - Block programming and AI applications

sections.title: Introduction to Block Programming
sections.content: Block programming uses visual blocks instead of text to create programs. It's like building with digital LEGO blocks where each block represents a command or instruction. This makes programming accessible and fun for everyone!

sections.title: Why Use Blocks?
sections.content: Block programming helps us learn programming concepts without worrying about spelling or syntax errors. We can focus on the logic and creativity of programming while the blocks handle the technical details.

sections.title: Basic Programming Concepts
sections.content: Before we create AI programs, let's understand the basic building blocks: sequences (doing things in order), loops (repeating actions), and conditions (making decisions).

examples.title: Simple Sequence
examples.content:
when green flag clicked
move 10 steps
turn 15 degrees
say [Hello!] for 2 seconds

sections.title: Creating Your First AI Program
sections.content: Let's create a simple AI program that can recognize and respond to different inputs using block programming. This is the foundation of how AI systems work!

examples.title: Simple AI Chatbot
examples.content:
when green flag clicked
forever
  ask [What's your favorite color?] and wait
  if <answer = [blue]> then
    say [Blue is a cool color!] for 2 seconds
  else
    say [That's a nice color choice!] for 2 seconds
  end

examples.title: Weather AI Assistant
examples.content:
when green flag clicked
ask [How is the weather today?] and wait
if <answer contains [sunny]?> then
  say [Great! Perfect day for outdoor activities!] for 3 seconds
else
  if <answer contains [rainy]?> then
    say [Don't forget your umbrella!] for 3 seconds
  else
    say [Thanks for sharing!] for 2 seconds
  end
end

sections.title: AI Decision Making
sections.content: AI programs make decisions based on rules and patterns. In block programming, we use conditional blocks (if-then-else) to create these decision-making processes. This is how AI 'thinks'!

examples.title: Smart Pet AI
examples.content:
when this sprite clicked
if <touching [mouse-pointer v]?> then
  say [I'm happy to see you!] for 2 seconds
  change [happiness v] by 10
else
  say [Come closer to play!] for 2 seconds
end

examples.title: Learning AI Game
examples.content:
when green flag clicked
set [score v] to 0
forever
  ask [What's 5 + 3?] and wait
  if <answer = [8]> then
    say [Correct! You're getting smarter!] for 2 seconds
    change [score v] by 1
  else
    say [Try again! Think step by step.] for 2 seconds
  end
end

sections.title: Pattern Recognition with Blocks
sections.content: One of the most important AI concepts is pattern recognition. We can teach our block programs to recognize patterns and respond accordingly.

examples.title: Pattern Detective
examples.content:
when green flag clicked
ask [Enter a sequence like: red, blue, red, blue, ?] and wait
if <answer contains [red]?> then
  say [I think the pattern continues with red!] for 3 seconds
else
  say [Let me think about this pattern...] for 2 seconds
end

sections.title: Building Smarter Programs
sections.content: As we combine different blocks and concepts, our programs become smarter and more helpful. This is the essence of artificial intelligence - creating programs that can learn, adapt, and help solve problems.

learningObjectives: Create simple AI behaviors using blocks
